subject: Self Care
title: The Wandering Mind
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Wandering Mind.

hook.text: Harvard research found people spend 47% of waking hours thinking about something other than what they're doing.

buildup.text: Mind-wandering activates the default mode network. It replays the past and rehearses possible futures.

discovery.text: The study also found that mind-wandering correlates with unhappiness, regardless of what people are doing.

twist.text: Some wandering is creative. But most of it is repetitive worry loops that solve nothing.

climax.text: Mindfulness interrupts the loop. Noticing you've wandered is the first step to returning to the present.

punchline.text: A wandering mind is an unhappy mind. Come back.

quiz.question: What percentage of waking time do people spend mind-wandering?
